alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:20PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 445 PM MDT... At 420 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Kit Carson, or 16 miles west of Cheyenne Wells, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Firstview. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
